meanings.definition: Relating to or involving both mental and physical activity.
meanings.sent1: The ideomotor exercises engaged both my mind and body.
meanings.sent2: She displayed ideomotor skills by combining mental focus with physical coordination.
meanings.sent3: His ideomotor abilities were put to the test during the challenging task.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved with ideomotor precision, seamlessly blending thought and action.
meanings.sent5: The ideomotor connection between mind and body was evident in her graceful movements.

meanings.definition: A subconscious or involuntary movement caused by a thought or idea.
meanings.sent1: The therapist observed an ideomotor response in the patient's hand movements.
meanings.sent2: He experienced an ideomotor twitch in his eye whenever he felt anxious.
meanings.sent3: The ideomotor of his foot tapping to the beat of the music was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her ideomotor of fingers drumming on the table revealed her impatience.
meanings.sent5: The ideomotor of the pendulum swinging back and forth captivated his attention.
